;According to media reports, many parents are now taking their children to work as "child slaves" in Hengdian, looking for opportunities to star in film and television dramas. The life of "child drifters" is also very bitter. "100 people fight for one seat", "earn 250 yuan in 4 months", and "pay a large amount of money to join the group" are the norm for many "child drifters".

;

;According to media statistics, among the films, online dramas, TV series and other film and television cultural works filmed in Hengdian in 2022, 230 will have underage entertainers participating, with more than 6,000 people participating. This number is not small, and it is also the reason why "child drifting" exists - Hengdian does provide opportunities to act and become famous.

;

;Of course, with the influx of children and their families from all walks of life who have dreams, "child drifting" quickly becomes involuntarily involved. The "child drifting" industry can no longer be said to be a pure dream-chasing story, but has evolved into a bizarre capital game.

;

;"With 20,000 yuan in 1 year, you are guaranteed to be in at least 3 plays within 1 year, and you can appear as special actors, etc.. With 50,000 in 3 years, you are guaranteed to be in at least 8 plays in 3 years, and you can be in special actors and roles, etc." , this is the charging model of several children's agency companies in Hengdian reported in the media. According to the payment amount, they are divided into various levels of "members" and then equipped with corresponding resources. Obviously, for families who lack economic foundation, "child drifting" is already very cruel, and the return rate is extremely low.

;

;Another problem with "child drifting" is that the main subjects of pursuing dreams are children. If they are in an unstable situation, what about education?

;

;The Compulsory Education Law stipulates that parents or other legal guardians of school-age children and teenagers shall ensure that they enter school on time, accept and complete compulsory education in accordance with the law. If parents let their children leave school early for the dream of being a child star, it is already suspected of breaking the law.

;

;Even if a child successfully completes compulsory education, the basic education is too weak, and the impact may be lifelong. The cost of "child drift" is too huge.

;

;Therefore, parents should have a more rational and comprehensive assessment of the risks of child abuse. After all, there is huge uncertainty in "what you do is what you want". Is it wise for a family to risk everything for an opportunity with a very low probability?

;

;Moreover, children do not yet have full capacity for civil conduct, and they do not actually have a complete and clear understanding of the nature of their own behavior. Many children do like acting, but they lack awareness of "sunk costs" - once their acting career is blocked, how can children return to their regular growth path? Children are ignorant of this, and parents who lack prudence are undoubtedly irresponsible.

;

;Of course, there is no need for public opinion to make excessive criticism of "child drifters" and their families. Some common criticisms on the Internet, such as "using children as money-making tools" and "parents have dreams of getting rich", are not necessarily accurate.

;

;It can be seen from the interviews that many parents just want to try their best to help their children realize their dreams because their children want to act. They are not necessarily profit-driven parents. This is essentially the same as asking their children to "attend a prestigious school". They have both chosen a very involutive path with uncertain prospects.

;

;While parents are advised to be cautious, society should also intervene. For example, whether those entertainment agencies are formal or not should actually attract the attention of relevant departments. Some parents reported that "bringing money to join the group" was suspected of being defrauded. After paying the money, not only did they have nothing to do, but they were also "blacklisted" by the person involved. For these, the market supervision department should follow relevant clues to investigate whether there are any violations of laws and regulations.

;

;A red line that cannot be blurred is: no matter what growth path a family chooses for their children, education must be compulsorily implemented.

;

;In any case, the bitterness of Hengdian's "child drifting" is, after all, an unspeakable involution. The journey of chasing dreams is of course full of hardships, but this path does not seem to fit in with a simple narrative of children’s growth.

;

;In view of this, parents still need to carefully consider whether "child drifting" is suitable for their family situations; and society should obviously work hard to eliminate the risks and hazards involved, protect the rights of minors, and at least allow them to There are fewer pitfalls on the road to "Tongpiao".

;

;On August 3, 2022, Hohhot, passengers took photos on the China Sports Lottery "Lucky Train" themed train. (People’s Vision/Picture)

;

;"The online platform is no longer available?" On November 15, 2023, Wu Yong, the owner of a sports lottery shop in Changxing County, Zhejiang Province, Another inquiry from a regular customer popped up on WeChat. He receives similar messages almost every day.

;

;Wu Yong operates 5 sports betting shops in the county. He was once the owner of the national outstanding sports betting outlets selected by the Sports Lottery Management Center of the State Sports General Administration. But now, he is planning to transfer three of the stores.

;

;On February 16, 2023, Wu Yong was detained by the Public Security Bureau of Jishui County, Jiangxi Province on suspicion of illegal business operations. He was released on bail after "returning the stolen goods" of 1.2 million yuan. Awaiting trial. The Jishui County Procuratorate determined that from 2019 to 2023, Wu Yong sold 127 million yuan in sports betting through the "Douya" App, making illegal profits of more than 8.1 million yuan.

;

;The operating model of the "Douya" App is that lottery players place orders online, and the store owners will issue tickets at offline lottery stores after receiving notifications. App operators make money by collecting a 1% handling fee from store owners.

;

;According to the indictment, there are nearly 14,000 lottery agency stores registered in Douya, with more than 2.71 million lottery players. From 2019 to 2023, the total number of lottery tickets sold through "Douzhao" was approximately 24.2 billion yuan.

;

;From a time perspective, the actions Wu Yong and others were accused of mainly occurred after the state cleaned up and rectified online lottery sales in 2015. In the past eight years, the Ministry of Finance has not Open authorization for online lottery sales.

;

;In the criminal law, one condition that constitutes the crime of illegal business is violation of "national regulations." However, the "Lottery Management Regulations" formulated by the State Council in 2009 do not provide for the sale of lottery tickets through the Internet. Relevant regulations are formulated by the Ministry of Finance and other relevant ministries and commissions. During the trial of this case, the focus of dispute between the prosecution and the defense was whether Wu Yong and others violated "national regulations" by selling lottery tickets through the Internet.

;

;;"Ban" brings dividends;

;

;Wu Yong's lottery The store business started ten years ago.

;

;In 2013, the year before the World Cup in Brazil, Wu Yong, a fan, rented a storefront in the business district of Changxing County and ran his first sports betting shop. Open.

;

;At that time, many leading Internet companies launched online lottery sales businesses on their respective platforms, and the business of offline lottery stores was not booming. According to Wu Yong, online lottery sales services have attracted a large number of young people. Before the start of the World Cup, the business of his lottery shop "basically only returned the money", and most of the customers were acquaintances who watched the football with him.

;

;After reviewing relevant public information, the Ministry of Finance has not publicly disclosed the size of the Internet lottery market. One data for reference is the "2014 Internet Lottery Market Analysis Report" released by Pantone Consulting, an organization that has long tracked the lottery market. It shows that in that year, China's Internet lottery sales reached 85 billion, doubling the sales volume in 2013. The market share exceeded 20% for the first time.

;

;However, the hot Internet lottery market was quickly cooled by policies.

;

;On January 15, 2015, the Ministry of Finance, the Ministry of Civil Affairs and the State Sports General Administration jointly issued the "Self-examination and self-correction work on unauthorized use of the Internet to sell lottery tickets" Notice on Problems". At the end of February, several Internet platforms including Alibaba, Tencent, NetEase, Sina, and People's Daily announced they would stop selling lottery tickets.

;

;Unexpectedly and unexpectedly, Wu Yong enjoyed multiple dividends brought by the "ban".

;

;Lottery players who were originally attracted by the Internet platform began to patronize his lottery shop. From time to time, people ask him that buying lottery tickets offline is too troublesome. Is there any way to buy lottery tickets online?

;

;While communicating with colleagues, Wu Yong learned about the application "87 Caidian" (the predecessor of "Douzha"). He found the company's phone number online and called to inquire. Afterwards, the company's sales staff contacted him and asked him to provide store photos, sales certificates, bank cards, ID cards and other qualifications for verification. After passing the approval, Wu Yong's online lottery business started.

;

;After lottery players download the App through the lottery store promotion code shared by Wu Yong, the purchased lottery tickets can only be issued from Wu Yong’s store. Since 2015, online sales have accounted for nearly half of Wu Yong’s total store sales. The subsequent COVID-19 outbreak has further accelerated the development of Wu Yong’s online business. “Almost 70% to 80% of lottery tickets sold through the App will be sold,” he estimated.

;

;2021 is Wu Yong’s best year, with online lottery sales reaching more than 40 million yuan.

;

;Football matches are mostly concentrated in the evening, and lottery players buy tickets half an hour before the game starts. An offline sports lottery store generally only has one terminal ticket issuing machine. When business is booming, the ticket issuing speed cannot keep up. Starting in 2018, Wu Yong successively applied for four sports lottery agency stores as a clerk or relative to absorb more orders.

;

;While using "Bean Sprout", Wu Yong noticed that some store owners were notified by the local sports lottery management center because of their use of this app, and their store sales permissions were suspended. In his store, there are also posters issued by the county sports lottery center prohibiting online lottery sales.

;

;But he "didn't take it seriously." After all, it would be difficult to even recoup the capital by relying on scattered customers in physical stores. “To survive, it is impossible not to use online channels.”

;

;Southern Weekend reporters learned from people close to the case that at least 62 lottery shop owners who have used "bean sprouts" are currently under investigation by the Jishui County Public Security Bureau.

;

;In addition to two shop owners who have been sued to court by the procuratorate, Southern Weekend reporters confirmed with the other six shop owners involved in the case that they were involved in the case between February and June 2023. He was successively released on bail by the Jishui County Public Security Bureau on suspicion of illegal business crimes, and is still under investigation by the public security organs.

;

;These six people expressed similar thoughts to Southern Weekend reporters, "Everyone is doing this. If you don't do it, won't you lose money?" said a shop owner.

;

;;Fluctuating policies;

;

;He and Wu Yong were prosecuted by the Procuratorate There is also another lottery shop owner, as well as Wang Lingfeng, the actual controller of Beijing Chun Xinya Technology Co., Ltd., the operating company of "Bean Sprout", and 6 employees.

;

;Wang Lingfeng entered the Internet lottery industry at the end of 2014. According to what he told Southern Weekend reporters, he entered the industry at the suggestion of the leader of a sports lottery management center in a certain province in East China. Since then, he has been invited by sports lottery centers in many places to provide training to shop owners, "How to use 'Internet +' thinking." Selling lottery tickets'". However, Southern Weekend reporters were unable to verify this with the sports betting agency he mentioned.

;

;In 2016, Wang Lingfeng mentioned in an interview with "Sina Pantone" that before the policy banning the sale of Internet lottery tickets was introduced in early 2015, the company had begun to cooperate with many places. The sports lottery center discussed cooperation. The center recognized their model and was willing to promote it to shop owners. After the ban was issued, all negotiations stopped.

;

;To his surprise, many lottery shop owners took the initiative to find the company. "At that time, I really felt that they were almost finished, but they actually survived."

;

;In that interview, Wang Lingfeng said that the biggest difficulty faced in starting a business is "policy."

;

;The Internet lottery system has experienced a process from tightening to relaxing and then tightening. In China, the only legal lotteries are sports lotteries and welfare lotteries licensed by the State Council. The Ministry of Civil Affairs and the State Sports General Administration are responsible for the management of national welfare lottery and sports lottery respectively, while the Ministry of Finance is responsible for the supervision and management of lottery.

;

;In December 2007, the Ministry of Finance, the Ministry of Civil Affairs, and the State Sports General Administration jointly issued the "Notice on Issues Concerning the Use of the Internet to Sell Lottery Lottery by Lottery Agencies", mentioning We must stop using the Internet to sell lottery tickets.

;

;But in 2010, the Ministry of Finance issued the "Interim Measures for the Administration of Lottery Sales on the Internet" (hereinafter referred to as the "Interim Measures"), pointing out that it is necessary to promptly select companies with Interim Measures Units with specified conditions and good management foundation shall submit to the Ministry of Finance for approval before launching pilot projects.

;

;The interim measures also emphasize that without approval, no unit may use the Internet to sell lottery tickets. However, this document is still interpreted by the industry as a positive signal, which means that the online lottery sales model, which was previously in a gray area, is expected to be legalized.

;

;With no organization approved by the Ministry of Finance, the Internet lottery industry has developed rapidly. Portals such as Sina and NetEase and e-commerce platforms such as Taobao, JD.com and Dangdang have all launched lottery services. According to Pantone Consulting statistics, in 2011, China’s Internet lottery sales exceeded the 10 billion yuan mark.

;

;In September 2012, the pilot online lottery sale was launched. The Ministry of Finance agreed with the Sports Lottery Management Center of the State Sports General Administration to entrust China Sports Lottery Network and 500 Lottery Network to carry out online sports betting business.

;

;In 2015, the policy gradually tightened, and relevant departments issued the aforementioned ban on online lottery sales.

;

;On April 28, 2016, the Ministry of Finance, the Ministry of Public Security, the former State Administration for Industry and Commerce, the Ministry of Civil Affairs, and the State Sports General Administration jointly issued a document pointing out that since 2015, The clean-up and rectification of online lottery sales has achieved initial results, but in some areas there are still problems with orders and prohibitions. The document once again emphasizes that lottery issuance and sales agencies and their agents are strictly prohibited from selling lottery tickets online without authorization.

;

;However, a survey released by CCTV in April 2018 showed that there are still more than 300 lottery websites in operation, with the annual lottery sales amount not less than 1,000 billion. During the start of the World Cup in Russia that year, multiple lottery apps appeared at the top of the download rankings of mobile application malls.

;

;Four months later, on August 21, 2018, the Ministry of Finance, the Ministry of Civil Affairs, and the State Sports General Administration jointly organized 12 ministries and commissions including the National Development and Reform Commission, the Ministry of Industry and Information Technology, and the Ministry of Public Security. An announcement was issued to resolutely prohibit unauthorized online lottery sales, and pointed out that the Ministry of Finance has not approved any lottery agency to open this business.

;

;13 days later, the Ministry of Finance, the Ministry of Civil Affairs, and the State Sports General Administration issued another decision on amending the "Implementation Rules of the Lottery Management Regulations", "Unauthorized use of the benefits of Internet sales Lottery and sports lottery" are included in the list of "illegal lotteries".

;

;;

;

;September 3, 2023, Beijing Service Trade Sports Lottery Exhibition in the Sports Services Exhibition Area. (People’s Vision/Picture)

;

;;"National Regulations";

;

;After the policy was tightened in 2015, the Ministry of Finance no longer authorized the sale of lottery tickets on the Internet.

;

;Currently, the Ministry of Finance, the Ministry of Civil Affairs, and the State Sports General Administration can only supervise provincial and municipal lottery distribution centers and agents. Su Guojing, founder of the China Lottery Industry Salon, believes that if online sales of lottery tickets are allowed, once "ticket stealing" and various disputes arise on the online platforms of non-lottery institutions, how and who will supervise them will become a big problem.

;

;The so-called "ticket eating" means that lottery players buy lottery tickets online, but the platform or agent does not actually issue the tickets, but directly pockets the ticket money. If a lottery player wins a small prize, they can cash it in directly. If a lottery player wins a large prize, the platform or the agent cannot pay the fee, and the site may be closed or run away.

;

;"Procuratorial Daily" reported a case of "ticket eating". Sun, the owner of a lottery shop in Shanghai, used the Internet to sell lottery tickets 508 from February to April 2019. Ten thousand yuan, the actual ticket issued was 4.43 million yuan, and the ticket consumption was more than 600,000 yuan. In 2020, the Shanghai Qingpu District Court sentenced Sun to 6 years and 6 months in prison for illegal business operations and fined him 600,000 yuan.

;

;On Douya, every few months, Wu Yong will be asked by customer service to randomly check the actual ticket issuance status. Customer service randomly selects 10 orders. Wu Yong needs to find the corresponding physical tickets, take photos and send them to customer service for review. Wu Yong said that for lottery players’ online orders, he actually issues all tickets offline. The indictment also did not mention his behavior of "eating votes".

;

;However, there will still be "fish that slip through the net" on the platform. A Hunan sports lottery shop owner who was prosecuted by the Jishui County Procuratorate along with Wu Yong was accused of "eating tickets."

;

;According to the indictment, from January 2019 to the end of 2021, he used the "Yuncaidian" App (also the predecessor of "Douzha") to sell 148 million lottery tickets. Yuan, the amount of "ticket eating" was more than 64 million yuan, and the illegal profit was more than 3.27 million yuan. In an interview with Southern Weekend, the shop owner said that he had indeed engaged in the behavior of "eating tickets".

;

;Unlike those who "eat tickets", lottery shop owners such as Wu Yong sell lottery tickets through apps, but issue tickets offline. Are they also suspected of illegal operations?

;

;In January 2022, the Xiushui County Court in Jiangxi Province issued a judgment on a similar case (hereinafter referred to as the "Xiushui Case"). Southern Weekend reporters learned from the defense lawyer of one of the defendants in the case that in this case, neither the lottery app nor the owner of the lottery shop withheld money from the tickets but did not issue them or "eat the tickets".

;

;The Xiushui County Court finally determined that the person in charge of the lottery selling app and several lottery shop owners who cooperated with the app were guilty of illegal business operations.

;

;The basis of the court's decision is that the "Implementation Rules of the Lottery Management Regulations" stipulate that lottery tickets sold on the Internet without authorization belong to the category of illegal lottery tickets. In addition, the App also set up copying and syndicated buying programs with a gambling nature, etc., which changed the rules for lottery sales and prize redemption. "The sales amount was extremely huge and the circumstances were extremely serious, disrupting the order of the lottery market."

;

;Article 225 of the Criminal Law defines the crime of illegal business as violating national regulations, operating specialty items stipulated in laws and regulations without permission, or otherwise disrupting market order. illegal business practices.

;

;After the defendant appealed, the court of second instance upheld the original verdict.

;

;The lawyer in the Xiushui case told Southern Weekend reporters that during the court session, one of the key points in the confrontation between the prosecution and the defense was, what are "national regulations"? As well as the relevant documents prohibiting online lottery sales without approval, are they considered "national regulations"?

;

;On October 9 and 10, 2023, the first instance of the illegal business case involving Wang Lingfeng, Wu Yong and other nine people was held in the Jishui County Court of Jiangxi Province. The above issues were also heard in court. in focus.

;

;Article 96 of the Criminal Law explains "violating state regulations" as violating the laws and decisions formulated by the National People's Congress and its Standing Committee, and the administrative regulations formulated by the State Council. Regulations, prescribed administrative measures, issued decisions and orders.

;

;Wu Yong’s defense lawyer and associate professor at the University of International Business and Economics Zheng Haiping pointed out in court that the "Lottery Management Regulations" were formulated by the State Council and fell into the category of "national regulations." However, the "Regulations" only prohibit the "unauthorized issuance and sale of lottery tickets" and do not explicitly prohibit the use of the Internet to sell lottery tickets.

;

;Prohibitive regulations on the use of the Internet to sell lottery tickets mainly appear in the "Implementation Rules of the Lottery Management Regulations" and the "Interim Measures for the Management of Internet Lottery". However, the former is formulated by the Ministry of Finance, the Ministry of Civil Affairs, and the State Sports General Administration, while the latter is issued by the Ministry of Finance. From a legal perspective, they are only departmental regulations and shall not be deemed as "violating national regulations."

;

;At present, the Jishui County Court has not made a first-instance judgment.

;

;;The distribution pattern may be broken;

;

;"Bean Sprout Case" The other six shop owners who have not yet been charged are also waiting for the verdict. They opened offline lottery shops in Fujian, Shandong, Jiangsu and other places. They all claimed that they did not "eat tickets". After paying "illegal gains" ranging from hundreds of thousands to millions, they were released on bail pending trial.

;

;After representing the illegal business case heard by the Xiushui County Court, the aforementioned lawyer who represented the Xiushui case successively received inquiries from parties in nearly ten similar cases. "More than 80% of cases are filed and investigated by the public security organs of Jiangxi Province." This means that lottery shop owners who use online sales are facing the risk of criminal offenses.

;

;Despite the risks, it is not uncommon for stores to sell lottery tickets through online channels.

;

;On November 13, 2023, Southern Weekend reporters randomly called 10 sports lottery stores in Beijing and asked as lottery players whether they could buy lottery tickets online. Eight lottery stores stated that they can add WeChat and purchase online, and two of them sent App download links for online sports lottery purchases.

;

;As far as the attitude of the regulatory authorities is concerned, the characterization of purchasing lottery tickets through the App is different from that of letting store owners purchase lottery tickets through WeChat.

;

;Southern Weekend reporters learned from the sports lottery management centers in Beijing, Zhejiang, Hunan and other places that purchasing lottery tickets through Apps is explicitly prohibited, but purchasing lottery tickets by adding the store owner’s WeChat account Whether it is a violation or not has not yet been clearly defined.

;

;The Huzhou Sports Lottery Center in Zhejiang Province, where Wu Yong is located, believes that buying lottery tickets on WeChat is an online lottery behavior and "is not as serious as illegal, but we do not advocate it." The Changsha Sports Lottery Center stated that if any lottery shop owners are found to be selling lottery tickets through WeChat channels, they “may be punished by withdrawing their tickets.”

;

;Why is it so difficult for online lottery sales to be loosened? Su Guojing told Southern Weekend reporters that in China, the public welfare nature of lottery is emphasized while its gambling attribute is weakened. Internet platforms provide more convenient sales channels and payment methods than offline purchases, but they may cause lottery players to become addicted and make it more difficult to control minors’ lottery purchases.

;

;Chen Haiping, associate professor at the School of Psychology at Beijing Normal University and former deputy director of the China Lottery Research Center, said that another problem caused by Internet lottery sales is that the original The distribution pattern of public welfare funds has been broken.

;

;Lottery funds are divided into three parts: bonuses, issuance fees and public welfare funds. According to regulations of the Ministry of Finance, half of the lottery public welfare funds in each province are turned over to the central finance, and the other half is retained in the provincial finance. The Internet sales of lottery tickets break geographical restrictions. In provinces with developed Internet economies, sales will increase and more public welfare funds will be retained in local finances. Provinces dominated by offline sales will inevitably lead to a decrease in public welfare funds. This can easily lead to unhealthy competition in lottery sales among provinces, which will not only break the original pattern of raising and distributing public welfare funds and create new inequality between rich and poor, but also lead to various market chaos.

;

;In Su Guojing's view, if the lottery industry does not introduce higher-level laws and "if the responsibilities and rights in Internet sales are not clarified, the problem cannot be completely solved." ".

;;There are many thoughts and memories in Pingshan Hall;

;

;; Yangzhou once had a dense population of outstanding figures from all dynasties, and its winding flower paths are layer upon layer filled with cultural gold dust. ;

;

;;

;

;Overlooking the Slender West Lake from the Qiling Pagoda of Daming Temple;(Lu Xiangqian/Photo);;

;Exiting the North Gate of Slender West Lake, across the road is the Daming Temple. Entering the slope of the scenic spot, the "Qiling Ruins" archway appears in front of you, with four pillars and three couplets, and double eaves and tile ridges. There is a stone plaque embedded in the wall on the east side of the courtyard. The big red characters "The No. 1 View in Huaidong" are very eye-catching. They come from Qin Guan's "Pingshan Hall" written by Ci Yunzi: "If a tourist talks about the beauty of climbing, he must write "The No. 1 View in Huaidong". Take a look."

;

;After passing the Tianwang Hall of Daming Temple, there is an octagonal doorway on the west side, passing through it is Pingshan Hall.

;

;In front of Pingshan Hall is a wooden flower gallery. The old wisteria planted on both sides are circling and twining. The dense branches and leaves and blooming wisteria flowers sprinkle the ground with coolness. I suddenly remembered the "weeping willow in front of the hall" and exited the flower gallery first. There are wintersweet, viburnum, boxwood, crape myrtle, etc. planted around. The leaves of magnolia are lush and moist. The tree is seven or eight meters high. It should be very gorgeous when in full bloom.

;

;There is a milky white stone on the grass on the south side of the vestibule, with the word "European Willow" written in big green characters on it. It is indeed there. Below is Ouyang Xiu's "Chaozhongcuo": "The sill of the flat mountain leans against the clear sky, and the mountain scenery is blurred. Weeping willows are planted in front of the hall, and there are few spring breezes..."

;

;The first year of Renzong Jiayou;(1056);, my friend Liu Chang was going to be appointed as the magistrate of Yangzhou. Ouyang Xiuwei gave this poem as a farewell farewell. It has been several years since he was transferred from Yangzhou, and he still misses the Pingshan Hall where he once visited. There is a hint of melancholy about the passage of time in the words, but the tone is broad-minded and clear, without any sense of decadence.

;

;I looked around, but there was no sign of the willow tree. It was a bit strange, so I continued searching. It turned out that it was right next to the stone, low, young, and leaning as if it was about to lie down. It was a tamarisk tree. The leaves are short and stubborn, not graceful at all. If you imagine the weeping willows planted by hand in Central Europe, they should be the delicate and slender ones.

;

;;

;

;Pingshan Hall;(Lu Xiangqian/Photo);

;

;Pingshan Hall is very crowded. Tour groups are coming and going. The couplet below the plaque of "Pingshan Hall" incorporates the vastness of time and space, the boundless wind and moon, and there are knowledgeable and knowledgeable scholars in the scenery: "When you lean on the railing at dawn, you can see the green mountains of six generations; when you come to drink wine at night, the bright moon is right above your head. On the east and west sides of the plaque, there are plaques "Sitting on Flowers and Carrying the Moon" and "Feng Liu Wan Zai" hanging high. The latter was inscribed by Liu Kunyi, the governor of Liangjiang in the late Qing Dynasty.

;

;In the windows of the east and west wings of Pingshan Hall, Sikuquanshu's "Six One Poetry", "Ouyang Wencui", "Wen Zhongji", etc. are placed; four wooden poetry plaques occupy half of the wall, recording He wrote poems by Su Zhe and others about Pingshan Hall. Mei Yaochen's "Thousands of Mountains Flying Shadows Across the River" and Su Che's "Looking down at the river and the mountains from the hall" both have a silhouette.

;

;In the eighth year of Renzong Qingli;(1048);, when Ouyang Xiu moved from Chuzhou to Yangzhou, he was still in the " The political low period after the failure of the Qingli New Deal. He cared about people's livelihood, and maintained a lenient and simple administration without slacking off. People in Chuzhou and Yangzhou felt his virtue and government, and built shrines to Ou Gong.

;

;After official duties, Ou Gong spent time in poetry and wine. He built a Pingshan Hall in the southwest of Daming Temple, where he could not only meet friends and relatives, climb high and look far away, but also enjoy the tranquility alone. He was very happy in the letter he wrote to Han Qi, his former magistrate: "Dupingshan Hall dominates Shugang, and the mountains south of the Yangtze River can be seen thousands of miles away."

;

;Looking at Ouyang Xiu's description, I thought Pingshan Hall was located. The Shugang is majestic and tall. Today, I was standing outside the hall. Under the stone railing directly south of the tamarisk tree, there was a piece of happy and beautiful red leaves. I tried to look into the distance again, but my sight was blocked by trees.

;

;Later, we took the elevator to the 70-meter-high Qiling Pagoda of Daming Temple, which was really good for the distant view. Pingchuan and vast fields stretch as far as the eye can see, with no peaks in sight. The gray buildings in the distance are as small as building blocks. The Slender West Lake at your feet is like a long scroll of scenery. The water bank is curved and lingering, as if randomly embedded in thick or light green trees, with a few pavilions scattered among it.

;

;;

;

;Daming Temple Qiling Pagoda (right) and Hongfo Pavilion;(Lu Xiangqiang/picture);

;

;Among the many stone carvings displayed in Pingshan Hall and Ouyang Temple, Dongpo's "Moon on the Xijiang River" and Ouyang Xiu's "The Drunkard's Pavilion" attract people's attention. The latter was written by Dongpo in Yingzhou. Shen Xiong's flexible regular script has always been favored by calligraphers. The lyrics of "Xijiang Moon" were written in Pingshan Hall.

;

;Su Shi’s feelings for Mr. Ou are unusual.

;

;Ouyang Xiu has always promoted virtuous people, and his grand reward for Su Shi was well known to the world. The prevailing Taixue style of writing at that time was tortuous, profound, difficult and eccentric, and Ouyang Xiu and others were determined to correct it. In the spring of the second year of Renzong Jiayou's reign (1057), Ou Gong, as the examiner of the provincial examination of the Ministry of Rites, wrote "the words are very simple and have no meaning". Su Shi, who was decorated by "Zhaozao", was promoted to the second place in the "Lun" examination. There are many famous people among this year's Jinshi, and the Jiayou Gongju Examination is regarded as "the first in the millennium imperial examination".

;

;After some well-known candidates who were determined to win the exam failed, they were angry and dissatisfied. Someone wrote a memorial letter as a prank and sent it to Ou Gong's house. There were also frivolous scholars who surrounded Ouyang Xiu and made noises in front of his horse. "Thousands of people gathered to laugh and curse." It was difficult for the patrolling soldiers to stop him. But since then, the sick writing style has gradually been reversed.

;

;Ouyang Xiu spoke highly of the three Sus, and Su Shi's rich and fluent writing impressed him even more. In his letter to Mei Yaochen, he happily said: "Reading Shi's book makes me sweat, so good, so good! I should avoid the road and let him go out of his way. What a joy, a joy!" This is the discovery of outstanding young people by senior writers. I can't help but feel happy, and it's the sympathy of genius for genius.

;

;Ou Gong’s support and expectations made Dongpo grateful for his whole life. He said that he was "the most deeply influenced by it". In the seventh year of Yuanfeng (1084), Dongpo traveled from Huangzhou to Ruzhou. When he passed through Yangzhou in October, he set foot on Pingshan again. Hall. He "remembers the drunkard every time he goes to Pingshan", and this time is no exception. The ink on the wall is still there, but my mentor has passed away. It has been more than ten years since we last met. Dongpo deeply missed Ou Gong with a piece of "Moon over the Xijiang River", and also lamented that time flies and things are illusory:

;

;;; After passing the Pingshan Hall three times, I heard the sound of a snap of my fingers;;. ;;I haven’t seen the old immortal in ten years, and dragons and snakes are flying on the wall. ;;    ;;

;

;;< em>;If you want to express your gratitude to the governor, you still sing the spring breeze of the willows. Don't say that everything will be empty when you turn around. When you don't turn around, it's all a dream. ;;

;

;Ou and Su, two literary loyal dukes, leaders of the two generations of literary circles, both set an example for the world with their moral articles. Both of their terms were short, but they made Yangzhou people miss them and made Pingshan Hall full of magnetism. Descendants came to worship in an endless stream, leaving many poems and essays, continuing a romantic tradition.

;

;Wang Shizhen's "Flowers and Grasses" said: Pingshan Hall is not high in terrain and has an ordinary environment. "However, the European and Su poems make the place heavy." Once the pavilions and pavilions are stained with the luster of a wise man, or Blessed by Li Cihongpian, it will be more charming. Even if the eaves and corners of the corridor columns have been worn away by time, they are still immortal.

;

;Pingshan Hall was abandoned and rebuilt several times. The existing buildings were rebuilt during the Tongzhi period and were subsequently overhauled many times. It made Yixingya feel beautiful and condensed a touching teacher-student friendship.

;

;;What can be done in half a year;

;

;By the time Dongpo came to Yangzhou as a prefect, it was more than 40 years after Pingshan Hall was built.

;

;Zhezong Yuanyou's seventh year;(1092); In February, Dongpo received his appointment in Yingzhou , he was very happy to move to Yangzhou. He took office in March and stayed in Yangzhou for less than half a year. It is difficult to achieve anything in such a short time, but he impressed the people with his good governance.

;

;Dongpo loves flowers. He plants flowers, appreciates them, gives them hairpins, sighs at them, and interacts with them in various ways. The plum blossoms, orchids, chrysanthemums, peonies, crabapples, camellias, and rhododendrons in his paintings are either beautiful or quiet, some stand alone, or the trees are full of beauty. He was also able to appreciate the charm of peony. He wrote a poem "Zhao Chang Peony" and said: "Yangzhou has been red with thousands of leaves recently, which is the beauty of the fashionable times."

;

;After Dongpo took office, he did A decision that ruined the scenery: the Wanhua Festival was cancelled. He wrote to his friend Wang Gong: The Wanhua Hui has become a big harm to Yangzhou, and the suspension of the Wanhua Hui "will ruin the scenery, but it will not cause karma." His article "Harming the People with Joy" said: Yangzhou peony is the best in the world, and Wanhua Hui uses flowers. More than 100,000 branches not only destroyed the gardens of various houses, but also disturbed the people and harmed the people. Yangzhou people were very dissatisfied. , causing harm to the poor people."

;

;The "Mozhuang Manlu" written by Zhang Bangji, a scholar of the Northern Song Dynasty, records: The Wanhua Hui began when Cai Jing learned about Yangzhou, and continued every year thereafter. The flower party was held, "everyone was excited and happy." Zhang Bangji commented: Su Gong’s administration was basically like this, benefiting the people, so he was praised by them.

;

;On his way from Yingzhou to Yangzhou, Dongpo witnessed the tragic situation of the people struggling to survive and being displaced: there were many refugees in the cities along the way, unable to pay their accumulated debts;(owing taxes to the government); and dare not return home. When traveling to the countryside, Dongpo often screened officials and visited villages. The elders all cried with sorrow: Although the summer wheat is ripe this year, the demand for payment of accumulated debts in the good years will be more stringent. "If the apprentice is at the door and the yoke is on the body, no one will be able to die." Dongpo couldn't help crying. He wrote two memorials: I once knew Hangzhou and Yingzhou, and now I went to Yangzhou. "I personally saw that the people in Zhejiang, Jingxi, and Huainan were all burdened by accumulated debts." They were increasingly in distress, and more than half of them were exiled or died. Huai and Zhejiang had the most accumulated debts and suffered from disasters year after year. The officials, under the supervision of their superiors, pressed for collection and threatened and flogged the civilians every day. How do people live in peace and contentment? How is the benevolent government of the imperial court reflected? Dongpo "said nothing" and asked the court to suspend collection for one year, "so that the people who have been trapped for a long time can know the joy of having a full meal."

;

;According to Su Shi's request, the imperial court issued an edict on June 1 that the debts accumulated on Huainan East and West Road and Liangzhe Road were suspended for one year. He couldn't help being happy: "The edict is generous and the debts are owed, and the father is of good looks. Congratulate me again, I won't be greedy for this treasure. I smiled slumped at Ruan Ji, and drank a few books to thank me."

;

;After investigation, Dongpo found out about Taxation, warehouse law, water transportation, etc. also put forward suggestions for improvement to promote the advantages and eliminate the disadvantages. Disciple Li Zhuo's "Teachers and Friends" records: In the past, the government allowed Gangyun's boatmen to carry goods privately to supplement their income. They often regard official ships as their home, repair them at any time, and sail them quickly. In recent years, private transport has been strictly prohibited. As a result, the bad people on the boats have become poor, and the amount of water and rice has been lost several times more than before. Both public and private companies have suffered losses. Some boatmen have stolen goods due to hunger and cold, and have broken down and sold the cars and boats. In Yangzhou, Chuzhou, Sizhou and other prefectures, many boatmen were whipped and sent away, and some became beggars and thieves. The memorial on Dongpo suggested restoring the old practice, which was approved by the court. The disadvantages are eliminated, both public and private parties benefit, and no one is punished for it. Li Lao quoted the words of "Zuo Zhuan" and lamented: "The words of a benevolent person are extremely beneficial."

;

;The Gulin Hall to the north of Pingshan Hall was built by Dongpo, and the existing buildings were rebuilt in the late Qing Dynasty. It is connected to Pingshan Hall by a corridor with red beams. Separated by a wall to the east of Gulin Hall is the Main Hall of Daming Temple.

;

;The three characters "Gulintang" on the forehead of the hall are derived from Dongpo's Dharma stickers. The couplet "Under the deep valley is graceful; in the high forest there are tall trees and trees" comes from his poem "Gu Lin Tang".

;

;The overall feeling of Gulin Hall seems to be less solemn than that of Pingshan Hall. From the perspective of etiquette, it is in line with the order of seniority and youth. Of course, the decoration is also very rich. On the walls of the lobby and the east and west wings, there are portraits of Ouyang Xiu, Mei Yaochen, and the Su brothers, "Jiayou Gongju Picture" and "Red Cliff Night Tour Picture", etc., and calligraphy of East and West. Poe Linyan Zhenqing's "Tie for a Seat" and his "Tie for Seeing", "Tie for One Night", etc. Displayed in the window are the yellow-covered "Song Dynasty Dongpo Collection" and the Siku Quanshu's "Dongpo Shu Biography". The walls are neatly arranged with poem plaques written by the "Four Scholars of Su Sect". Among them, Chao Buzhi's seven-line poem "Zhao Jinyun Guards Guan Yanyuan, Professor Zeng Yan and Ji Pingshan Hall" was written when he invited Zeng Yanhe and others to gather at Pingshan Hall: " "Shu Gang is connected to Shu Mountain, and dragons and tigers reach up to the purple sky... There are no traces of Shaoshi Yangliu." From the latter sentence, it seems that Ougong Liu no longer existed when Chao wrote the poem.

;

;;

;

;"Jiayou Gongju Picture" on the wall of Gulin Hall;(Lu Xiangqiang/picture);

;

;In the fifth year of Yuanyou of Chao Buzhi ; (1090); served as the general magistrate of Yangzhou. Dongpo knew about Yangzhou, and he served as his deputy, and the teacher and student got along well with each other.

;

;In the seventh year of Yuanyou's reign; (1092); In August, Dongpo received the imperial edict and served as Minister of War and concurrently In the southern suburbs, the envoy Lu Bo was enshrined. After repeated urging from the imperial court, Dongpo arrived in Beijing in September.

;

;Chao Buzhi was the son-in-law of Du Chun, the minister of the Ministry of War. When Dongpo took over, he happened to be Du Chun's immediate boss. Considering that his father-in-law and his teacher had never been close together before, and he was worried that they would not get along so well, Chao Buzhi introduced to Dongpo Du Chunli's style of life and the advantages of being an official and benefiting all things. Later, his father-in-law wrote a letter saying that he had a good time working with Dongpo, but he felt that he was "arrogant and argumentative." Chao Buzhi replied with a long letter, detailing Su Gong's high integrity in governing:

;

;I have nothing to praise for the fact that Su Gong is a corporal. However, he is upright, pure and has few desires. He has become extremely frugal, but he takes on official responsibilities. He is jealous of evil and loves things. He does everything he knows, especially if he does not neglect the details.

;

;Chao Buzhi bluntly refuted his father-in-law - he did not think that Mr. Su had this problem: "The letter came from him because he was so arrogant and argumentative. This is beyond Bu's knowledge." He also reminded his father-in-law: People Not sages, everyone has his shortcomings and strengths. He gave the example of Ji An and Zheng, the famous officials of the Western Han Dynasty: they had different temperaments and had different brilliance and flaws, but Sima Qian praised them as virtuous. Therefore, "Gentlemen use the same to differentiate, if that is possible." Chao Buzhi believed that if all the sages were harmonious in the court, then the local good deeds would be consistent with the court, and then nothing would be impossible. This son-in-law is really serious about arguing with his father-in-law and defending his master. Chao Buzhi was the earliest known among the four scholars of Su family, and his admiration for Su Gong can be seen.

;

;Walking to the small garden on the north side of Gulin Hall, this corner is relatively quiet. A group of rockeries, several old osmanthus trees, the slanting branches of the osmanthus cover the ridge of the green tile roof, and the tall maple poplars and bamboos sway in the wind.

;

;;

;

;Small garden on the north side of Gulintang;(Lu Xiangqiang/picture);

;

;Dongpo After arriving in Yangzhou, he was in poor health and rarely received guests. After receiving the tea as a gift from Mao Zhengzhong, he organized a dinner party on the Dragon Boat Festival and entertained guests with sumptuous dishes and rice dumplings in accordance with the solar terms. He especially used the clear water from Shujing to cook tea. Dongpo confessed: "Repaying the favor to the king is not in vain. You know that I am not sipping lightly." Mr. Mao's good tea was not given to the wrong person. Now you know how solemnly I drank it.

;

;After Gulin Hall was built, Dongpo also drank tea in the woods beside the hall, right?

;

;;Writing poetry almost got into trouble again;

;

;Very different from the hustle and bustle of Slender West Lake, Zhuxi Park is sparsely populated and quiet. It is located on the bank of the ancient canal and was built in 1989 near the ruins of Zhuxi Temple. The scenery inside is good, it seems like the back garden of a Yangzhou person's home. There are not many outsiders to disturb it, and it is quietly beautiful.

;

;After the rain, the air is cool and moist, and the patches of ginkgo, osmanthus, pine, bamboo, red maple, etc. become cleaner and fresher. The camellias are in full bloom, and the dense, finely chopped off-white flowers of pittosporum exude a light fragrance. There are shallow mountains, thatched pavilions, stone bridges, bonsai, and several old ruins of former sites, all of which are impressive. On the left side of Zhuxi Jingshe stands a portrait of Wu Daozi, a praise inscribed by Li Bai, and a copy of the Three Jue Stele written by Yan Zhenqing.

;

;;

;

;"Three Jue Monuments" in Zhuxi Park;(Lu Xiangqian/Photo);

;

; The water area in Zhuxi Park is not small, with streams and lakes, and the water is introduced from canals. The semicircular bridge hole of Yueming Bridge connects with the reflection in the water, just like a full moon.

;

;Behind the pond deep in the park, there are two vertical corridors of inscriptions, displaying poems by Du Mu, Wang Anshi, Qin Guan, Jiang Kui and others in praise of Yangzhou. Dongpo's poem stele "Ci rhymes with Su Bogu's visit to Shugang and sending Li Xiaobo as envoy to Lingbiao", which was once a treasure of Zhuxi Temple. Later, the poem stele disappeared. Wang Shizhen went to the temple to search carefully and found the ruins of the stele. He brushed away the cobwebs and dust, and "sighed three times, as if he were talking to the public and singing in reciprocity that day." Then Ci Yun wrote "The Stone Engraving Poems of Visiting Mr. Dongpo in Shangfang Temple", "I remember the Emei people, their literary talent is truly immortal." The stele. On display in the gallery are copies.

;

;;

;

;Zhuxi Park Stele Corridor;(Lu Xiangqian/Photo);

;

;Su Dongpo's "Return" In front of the stele of poems "Yixing, "Three Poems inscribed on Zhuxi Temple", there is a large rosy red rhododendron, full of flowers and brilliant colors, which perfectly matches his cheerful and joyful poems. The third one wrote:

;

;;I feel that nothing has happened in this life, and I am still having a great year this year. ;

;

;;I am happy to hear the good words after returning from the mountain temple, and the wild flowers and birds are singing. ;

;

;In the spring of the eighth year of Yuanfeng (1085), Dongpo received Shenzong’s edict. Allowed to live in Changzhou. He happily returned south from Nandu ; (today's Shangqiu, Henan); and arrived in Yangzhou in late April. The pastoral dream has come true, and I feel good. On the first day of May, I visited Zhuxi Temple with my friends. I was entertained and enjoyed everything I saw and heard. I couldn't help but write poems.

;

;;

;

;Su Dongpo's Poetry Monument in Zhuxi Temple;(Lu Xiangqian/Photo);

;

;A quilt in the park In a corner hidden by bamboo branches and holly, there is an old well. The wall of the small gray stone well is more than a foot above the ground, and there are several deep marks on the inside that have been made by the well ropes over the years. The word "Shujing" is engraved on the stone tablet about one meter high next to it, which was inscribed by Professor Qin Ziqing, a descendant of Qin Guan. Shujing, also known as the "First Spring", is one of the eight scenic spots in Zhuxi Temple. Ancient people said that the water from the well tastes sweet.

;

;Zhuxi Temple is located at the end of Sichuan Hill, where the hills tend to become gentle. It is said that the ground veins of Shugang are connected with Shu, and the spring veins are also connected with Shujiang River. Therefore, Dongpo called the water from Zhuxi Temple the flavor of his hometown, and he wanted to carry the well water with the flavor of his hometown to his new home in the south of the Yangtze River. It's so pleasant.

;

;Unexpectedly, he almost got into trouble again with poetry. In the sixth year of Yuanyou's reign ; (1091); when Dongpo was appointed as a Hanlin scholar and knew how to make imperial edicts, his political enemies went so far as to check the records for Luo Zhi. It was said that Emperor Shenzong died in March of the eighth year of Yuanfeng. Su Shi regarded this as a "good word" when he wrote a poem, and he was overjoyed. Dongpo quickly wrote a letter to defend himself, saying that he returned to Changzhou after mourning the late emperor in Nandu in early March. When I went to Zhuxi Temple in early May, "I saw a dozen people, elders of the common people, talking and laughing to each other. One of them put his hands on his forehead and said, 'See, what a young official!'" I was pleased to hear that the common people were praising the young emperor. Sincerely; in addition, his request to return to Changzhou to farm was approved; when passing through Huaihe and Zhejiang, he saw a good harvest in sight, so he wrote a poem and inscribed it on the wall of the temple. If I have any bad intentions, how dare I openly show them to others? Moreover, it had already been two months since the death of the late emperor.

;

;Finally no danger.

;

;;

;

;Zhuxi Park is very quiet;(Lu Xiangxiang/Photo);

;

;Zhuxi Park Located on Zhuxi Road, there are also streets named after Zenzhi, Shangfang, etc. in the surrounding area. Go east out of the south gate of the park, go to the intersection, and turn north onto Jiangdu North Road. The small high-rise residential building on the right side of the road is called Zhonghai Shixi. I feel that the quality of the community is good. It must be a pleasant sight for residents to overlook the garden path of the park from their balconies. Three to four hundred meters ahead is Zenzhi Road, a slightly narrower branch road. On one side of the road is a construction site, surrounded by beige walls with slogans such as "Yangzhou is my home, take good care of it." Continue north along Jiangdu North Road, and the next intersection is Shangfangsi Road. There is less traffic, the road is smooth, and occasionally three or two pedestrians walk leisurely.

;

;Zhuxi Temple, also known as Zenzhi Temple and Shangfang Temple, was originally the palace of Emperor Yang of the Sui Dynasty. Later it became a famous temple and hosted many emperors, famous ministers and literary figures. It was destroyed by war in 1853. From palaces and gardens where emperors enjoyed themselves, to famous temples where eminent monks resided, to historical sites where poets lingered, they transformed into parks, communities, and streets where citizens walked... This corner of the soil has lost so much prosperity and joy that it has melted away.

;

;From the Tang Dynasty to the Qing Dynasty, countless poems were written about Zhuxi Temple, and many brilliant figures in the history of literature left their traces here. It's romantic and arouses people's imagination.

;

;If their figures were reproduced on film, it would look like this: Du Mu came with the sound of cicadas after the autumn rain, the surrounding moss covered the steps, and the sweet-scented osmanthus fluttered; Zhang Hu walked through the bustling ten-mile street , went to Zhuxi Temple, stood on the Yueming Bridge, watched the beauties parading around, and sighed that if he wanted to die, he would die in Yangzhou; Dongpo was particularly active. After entering the temple, he drank Jisu water first, then Yingsu soup, and borrowed vines. The bed was made of tile pillows, so I lay down and enjoyed the cool bamboo breeze. Before I left, I didn't forget to draw a jar of well water and dip it in ink to write a poem on the wall.

;

;His "image" materials are the most abundant and vivid.

; Mon, 20 Nov 2023 10:25:03 +0800 抢课大战后，年轻人在夜校找到了生活的盼头http://www.infzm.com/contents/260905
;;2023-11-20 09:00:00;
;

;After the countdown reached zero, the system crashed.

;

;In order to prepare for this battle to grab classes, Jim, a girl born in the 1990s, specially made a form and arranged the volunteers in order of priority, including African drum lessons, hand disc lessons, silver jewelry making classes and tie-dye craft classes. . The plan could not keep up with the changes, and on August 11, the system crashed as soon as it was started. She was lucky enough to get a spot in an African drum class. "It's like grabbing tickets for a concert," she said. "I have to have a sense of belief. I have to get it."

;

;500 yuan, 12 lessons, Each class is one and a half hours long. In the fall of 2023, night school, a mass life with a sense of the times, suddenly became popular on social platforms. According to data from Meituan and Dianping, searches for “night school” on the platform increased by 980% year-on-year.

;

;Ren Yi, a "senior student" at the Shanghai Citizen Night School, experienced firsthand the enthusiasm that he had never experienced before. Around 2018, she accidentally learned about the existence of citizen night schools. Her mother originally wanted to learn mobile phone photography, but when she signed up for the night school, she found out that the age limit was between 18 and 55 years old. There is a special "senior college" for seniors over 55 years old. ".

;

;Ren Yi has since "entered the pit". In the past five years, she has tried leather goods classes, crochet classes, and buttoning classes one by one. She said that at that time, citizen night schools were not as popular as they are today, and “you could basically get them by sticking to the spots (open places).” Most of the night school courses at that time were common subjects such as calligraphy and painting, yoga, and vocal music. Five years later, the registration page is confusing. There are many courses on the list that can arouse interest just by looking at the names, such as "Pet-Friendly Social Courses", "Shanghai-style Drinking Tea", "December Flower Goddess Series Courses".

;

;The purpose of young people joining night classes is very simple. A girl explained her intention to Southern Weekend reporter: "Socialize, meet more like-minded people, or you just want to learn a new skill, or just go and see Look, if you can learn, just learn, if you don’t, forget it. It doesn’t matter.”

;

;Under the fierce situation, Ren Yi encountered the waterloo of rushing to class, but in the end he got good luck. In a dynamic system where people drop out of classes at any time, she missed one class.

;

;;Flock into night schools to “learn art”;

;

;Ren Yi prefers handicraft courses and has previously taken leather goods and crochet classes at night schools. In the leather goods class, they use a complete piece of vegetable-tanned leather as a starting point. After cutting, punching, and stitching, they learn to sew card holders, key bags, or gold bags.

;

;In the buckle class in the fall of 2023, the new object she fiddled with was the buckle, a button used to fix the placket of traditional clothing. The course starts at 7pm on a weekday and lasts for one and a half hours. She coiled long soft buckle strips into various kinds of buttons, such as gourd-shaped and swallow-shaped.

;

;Time flies by. "Every time, we may not be able to finish the work at the end, but the cleaning lady is so anxious that she has to get off work, so she rushes us." Ren Yi considers herself to be a relatively clumsy student in the class, "but I just never tire of it."

;

;;

;

;In the buttoning class, students learned to make the buttons that fasten the placket of traditional clothing. ;(Photo courtesy of interviewee);

;

;Lu Eryu is a freelance illustrator. His daily routine is "sleep early in the morning and get up at noon." "The night class at seven o'clock every night happened to be a relatively sober moment of her day. She signed up for tea art classes, flower art classes and Yue opera classes, which were held from 7 to 8:30 pm every Wednesday, Thursday and Friday respectively.

;

;Lu Eryu said that the tea art class and the flower art class are "leisure and leisurely". If you spend thousands of dollars to learn it outside, it is not worth it. It is better to use the money to learn a language, which will look better. Practical knowledge. The low price of night school lowered the threshold for her to get involved in such hobbies.

;

;;

;

;Lu Eryu’s tea class notes. ;(Photo courtesy of interviewee);

;

;In the past, if I wanted to learn this kind of course, I could only search it online. Being able to identify the level of a teacher “may lead to being deceived”. Before signing up, Lu Eryu paid attention to the background of the tea art teacher. He was a "first-class tea art technician" and "an inheritor of tea ordering in the Song Dynasty", with reliable qualifications. The teachers at Citizen Night School have been screened, and the course introductions are clearly listed, which saves you a lot of trouble. “You may have something you want to learn, but when you think of complicated things to understand, keep asking these questions. That home, maybe the enthusiasm has worn off after the consultation.”

;

;She likes the atmosphere of the tea art class very much. There are more than ten people in groups of four or five. A group of people listened to the teacher talk about the origin of tea and the brewing method of black tea. The teacher taught the formula for memorizing the six types of tea, "'traffic light (black tea, green tea, yellow tea)', plus 'black, white, and green'".

;

;;

;

;Tea art classes at night schools are cheaper than training courses on the market, and the teacher qualifications have been specially screened, making it convenient and reliable for young people. ;(Photo courtesy of interviewee);

;

;In the tea art class, the teacher brought different brands of mineral water or purified water and poured it on In a transparent cup, everyone can blindly taste the taste of tea made with different water. Tools that measure pH value can measure "some water is 7.37, some is 8.08, and some is 6.26." Lu Eryu observed that the pH value of water usually has little impact on the taste, while the hardness and mineral content of water will bring about polarizing evaluations.

;

;In the handicraft class that Ren Yi took, the last class was usually a results report, where everyone displayed the results of the semester. "The long table in the entire classroom is filled with various works of everyone. If there is a night market today, our entire class can come out to practice stalls."

;

;;

;

;Achievements of the handicraft class. ;(Photo courtesy of interviewee);

;

;;It is not something that needs to be persisted;

;

; "I signed up for night school simply because of several considerations. First, it is very economical. Courses of the same quality and content may cost two or three times the price on the market. Second, it is very secure and the risk is relatively low. It is a project run by the Shanghai Mass Art Museum. It is not like many hobby training institutions outside, which have been affected by the economic downturn. I ran away before finishing the course, and my money was wasted. ." Jim told Southern Weekend reporters.

;

;She has only been officially employed for a few years. She works in a government agency, and her profession requires her to maintain a "serious and rigorous image." She has certain standards for both her professional image and her own behavior. But during African drum lessons, she doesn't have to be so tight.

;

;Every day, Jim commutes by bicycle, carrying a backpack with an African drum behind him. From a distance, he looks like a backpacker. A solid wood African drum weighs five or six pounds. When her colleagues asked her if she was going out to play, she never explained, "I said I was just going out to play." After get off work, she took off her professional clothes, changed into casual clothes, rode 20 minutes to the night school, and then rode home for half an hour.

;

;The teacher who teaches African drum lessons knows a variety of instruments, such as ukulele, ruan, guitar, and keyboard. There are 12 lessons. The first half starts with basic quarter notes and eighth notes, and is interspersed with rhythmic teaching in the middle. Now that the course is halfway through, she is struggling with the latest assignment - the teacher requires everyone to compose a song of their own. She observed that African drum teachers pay great attention to cultivating their arrangement skills, so that after they learn it, they can convey their life insights through the instrument instead of just typing out a melody written by others according to the score.

;

;"(Djembe drumming) is not something that I need to insist on. I don't find it burdensome. It is something that I can relax after work." Jim said.

;

;After weighing the distance of the class location, the time cost and the urgency of learning, Sun Yiran finally chose the bridge class. This is a very mental chess and card game. ;

;Sun Yiran feels that taking night classes once a week will not put too much pressure on him. "There are really other more important things, and I have other time to deal with them."

;

;She is usually engaged in data analysis work. According to her, it is to organize, analyze and output information into facts that "anyone can see is like this". "Work is not a purely rational state. ;

;A multiplayer chess and card game, it can also be fun to observe the different styles of players on the bridge table. It is very long; and the game is just treated as a game, tending to let the opponent directly tell the cards, and everyone thinks about what to do together.

;

;;

;

;

;Sun Yiran described the weeknights before going to night school as boring and time-killing. "Eating dinner, working out, and watching variety shows are all over. ;

;

;"Nowadays, young people are under greater work pressure than before, and they need more release and some fun. Everyone has different ways of having fun." ;

;;"Every I am looking forward to it every week.”;

;

;After incorporating night school into their weekly schedule, these young people also feel the changes that their seemingly useless spare time has brought to their daily lives.

;

;According to the results of the MBTI personality test, Lu Eryu is an "I person". In the "Liberating Nature" Yue Opera class, everyone has to stand up to sing, press their legs, and run in circles. ;

;

;Jim said that this is the opposite of the "involution" that everyone is keen to talk about now. ;

;Back in the classroom again, Sun still felt that the atmosphere in night school was much better than that in college or middle school.
